dct_title_s: A Correct Map of the WORLD Describing Capt. Shelvock’s Voyage round
dct_description_sm: Double hemisphere map showing California with two bays on the northern part of the island. Island labeled California with C. S. Luca at the southern tip. Area to the north and west is blank.
Map shows the route of Captain George Shelvocke’s circumnavigation of the globe.
Faint trace of type above the western hemisphere reading “THE WORLD.”
Issued in: A voyage round the world by the way of the great South Sea / By Capt. George Shelvocke. -- London: Printed for J. Senex ... MDCCXXVI (1726).
Reissued as a second edition in 1757 with a new imprint: London: W. Innys and J. Richardson ... 1757.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
